content.description: Start about five feet right of Exalted Easterners. Climb the steep face just left of an easy corner to a ledge. Climb the thin crack up a slabby face above to the wide crack and the top.
content.protection: Large cams are needed for the anchor.
content.location: Start about five feet right of Exalted Easterners.

climbs.name: Hellraiser
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Dave Haber, Sheryl Haber, Rick Briggs & Brandt Allen, Aug 1992

content.description: Located at Hall of Horrors East Wall - Den of Doom, left (west) of Rocky Horror Picture Show and below it in a narrow corridor on a short southeast facing face with a giant white flake. Face climb up and left to the left side of the flake and then up and right along the left side of the flake.
content.protection: Five bolts protect this route nicely. Bolt anchor. The first bolt is shared with another route that goes straight up the spoogy white face. Â A #1 camelot can protect moves to reach the first bolt if you feel the need for it.
content.location: Down climb the back side easily puts you back at the base in seconds.

content.description:
Start the same as

Hellraiser

but after clipping the 1st bolt on that route shuffle right along a narrow ledge to reach a 2nd bolt. Move up and slightly right past edges and slopers to a poorly placed bolt then make one final move to gain the ramp of

Hellraiser

and finish up that route past it's last bolt.

There's only about 20' or so of separate climbing on this route - perhaps it would have been better left as a TR.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2.5' piece, bolted anchor (all bolts are 3/8")

content.description: This route is located on the backside of the wall with Hellraiser, Hellbender, et al. The climb is located in a narrow corridor. Climb the face 10 feet to the left of Hellcat.
content.protection: Poor protection to lead, but can be top roped.
content.location: This route is located on the backside of the wall with Hellraiser, Hellbender, et al. The climb is located in a narrow corridor about 10 feet to the left of Hellcat.

content.description: This route is located on the backside of the wall with Hellraiser, Hellbender, et al. The climb is located in a narrow corridor about 20 feet to the left of Hellcat. Start about 10 feet left of Hellhound where the corridor is narrow enough that you can chimney to start the route.
content.protection: Poor protection to lead the route, but it can be top roped.
content.location: This route is located on the backside of the wall with Hellraiser, Hellbender, et al. The climb is located in a narrow corridor about 20 feet to the left of Hellcat and 10 feet left of Hellhound.

content.description: This route is located on the backside of the wall with Hellraiser, Hellbender, et al. The climb is located in a narrow corridor. Climb the left-leaning thin crack/seam that is at the right end of the wall.
content.location: This route is located on the backside of the wall with Hellraiser, Hellbender, et al. The climb is located in a narrow corridor.

content.description: Climb the obvious left-facing crack/flake to the right of Hellraiser. The crux is at the bottom.
content.location: Start to the right of Hellraiser at an obvious left-facing crack/flake.

content.description: Climb the face between Scare Factor and Creature Features, moving slightly right in the upper bulge.
content.location: Climb the face between Scare Factor and Creature Features.

climbs.name: Flakes of Doom
climbs.fa: Warren Huges & Mike Van Volkem, October 1991

content.description: Starting from a small boulder at the base climb up a featured crack and patina plates to the top. Despite the appearance of some holds everything seems solid. One star out of five.

climbs.name: Exalted Easterners
climbs.fa: George Hurley, Terry English, Todd & Donette Swain 03-2010

content.description: Start just left of two boulders at the base of a left leaning crack. Climb up and left along the crack then step right onto easier terrain and up to the top. This route and the next (Wayward Westerners) are sunny and quite sheltered on a windy day.
content.protection: The best TR anchor uses large (green and red) Camalots in a wide crack just below the top.
content.location: Begin about 150 feet left (southwest) of the Den of Doom on a ledge that is about 30 feet above the desert floor. The best approach is via a short water runnel that leads up a slab behind a boulder. Go up and left about 50 feet to the base of the route. The route is visible from the parking lot.

climbs.name: Doomsday
climbs.fa: Warren Hughes & Mike Van Volkem, October 1991

content.description: Located at Hall of Horrors East Wall - Den of Doom, left (west) of Rocky Horror Picture Show and Creature Feature on a short southeast facing brown buttress and face.  Face climb up and left on this steep face with nice holds.
content.location:
Right side of the obvious patina face 200' left of

Creature Feature

.

climbs.name: Doomed
climbs.fa: Warren Hughes & Mike Van Volkem, October 1991

content.description:
Clip a low bolt then climb solid patina edges with no protection up to a horizontal crack, plug some gear and then finish up a thin crack in the upper block. One star out of five.

Runout but solid climbing make this a good lead for those who'll find it casual otherwise it makes a fine toprope.
content.location:
15' left of

Doomsday

starting from atop a boulder.

content.description: Face climb up this steep face with nice varnished holds left of a large flake. Easy downclimb off the backside.
content.location: You'll find it in a narrow corridor on a short face with a giant white flake visible on the approach.
